result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger J Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.
The Court orders DNA sample to be collected at report date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger J Young

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporter Megan Theobald. Defendant Roger J Young in court.  Attorney Jennifer Lynne Miller in court for Roger J Young.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 5 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence on November 28th, 2022 at 7:00 am  

-Days credit to jail: 2 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-The Court orders DNA sample to be collected at report date.

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

02:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom.. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
